briefTitle: Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Ferric Carboxymaltose (FCM) in Patients With Iron Deficiency Anemia and Impaired Renal Function
officialTitle: Randomized Evaluation of Efficacy and Safety of Ferric Carboxymaltose in Patients With Iron Deficiency Anemia and Impaired Renal Function
summary: The primary objective of this study is to examine the efficacy and safety (cardiovascular) of an investigational intravenous (IV) iron, ferric carboxymaltose (FCM), compared to IV iron sucrose (Venofer) in subjects who have iron deficiency anemia (IDA) and impaired renal function.

primaryOutcome.measure: Mean Change From Baseline to the Highest Observed Hemoglobin Any Time From Baseline to End of Study.
